rows.transcript_1:
Close your eyes and think about the day. 

Name one thing that you are grateful for. 
Name one thing that you did well. 
Name one thing that you love.

Well done, you are a hero!
rows.transcript_2:
Tutup mata anda dan fikirkan tentang hari ini.

Sebut satu perkara yang anda rasa bersyukur.
Sebut satu perkara yang anda lakukan dengan baik.
Sebut satu perkara yang anda sayangi.
Bagus sekali, anda memang hebat!
rows.title: One thing today

text_1.eng: You matter! Take a moment to check in with yourself.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers but you really do your best!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!

text_1_facilitator.eng: There are different ways to praise your child. What do you think about the following?

quiz_1_question.eng: True or False: The way you praise your child does not matter because any kind of praise is effective.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
â­ Children who are praised for good behaviour will want to keep behaving well and keep receiving praise. 

4ï¸âƒ£ Here are 4 simple tips for praising your child:

section_1_text.eng: ğŸ‘€ Look for anything good or helpful your child does.

section_2_text.eng:
ğŸ† Praise them and tell them specifically what they have done well.
ğŸ‰ Be enthusiastic and really mean it!
ğŸ”„ This means they are more likely to do it again.

section_3_text.eng:
ğŸŒ· Look for something to praise your child for every day.
ğŸ”¶ Even if it is something really small, keep doing it.

section_4_text.eng:
ğŸ’¡ Make sure you focus on something your child has done well.
ğŸ™‚You can show your praise with a big smile or words. You can also clap, hug, or tickle your child to show you appreciate them.
â˜€ï¸ Keeping it positive reminds your child that you notice them and care.
